title: Vtg Stencil US No. 2 / Vtg Stencil Ornaments A
content:
astype releases Vtg Stencil US No. 2 and Vtg Stencil Ornaments A

available on Myfonts:  
 [Vtg Stencil US No. 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414181018/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astype/vtg-stencil-us-2/?refby=as) | [Vtg Stecnil Ornaments A](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414181018/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astype/vtg-stencil-ornaments-a/?refby=as)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414181018im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VtgStencilUSNo2_01_6482.png)

companien fonts: [Vtg Stencil US No. 51](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414181018/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astype/vtg-stencil-us-no-51/?refby=as) | [Vtg Stencil US No. 72](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414181018/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astype/vtg-stencil-us-72/?refby=as)
author: andreas

comments.content: Based on real stencils? Well, it shows. For the record, I need only walk about a kilometre to spot a collection of old herring barrel stencils.

Sorry, not exactly on-topic, but since you're here... Just yesterday I noticed the ampersand in your Secca, and was wondering: how did you decide on that form?

hhp
